attributes.action: Government to reimburse all British taxpayers for Pro-EU propaganda leaflet
attributes.additional_details:
It is 'morally wrong' to use public funds to promote one side of an argument exclusively when polling indicates the majority of the British public support leaving the EU. I pay my taxes so children can go to school, the sick and elderly be cared for and so public services run. 

I did not consent to my tax contribution being used to further the prospects of an organisation I strongly oppose. I want my misappropriated tax back!

NB: In this circumstance, the term 'majority' does not mean 36.9%
attributes.background:
All 29.7 million British tax-payers deserve a £0.30 tax-rebate to reimburse them for the misappropriation of public funds to further a government agenda.

'Let's be clear' the government haven't used THEIR money, there is no such thing as 'the government's money', it's OUR money.

rejection.details: The cost of compensating tax payers as the petition suggests would be borne by the taxpayer, so it is not clear how taxpayers could be reimbursed in this way.
